intro: Mandevilla subsagittata, commonly known as the arrowleaf mandevilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a vigorous, evergreen vine characterized by its heart-shaped, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in warm climates and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Mandevilla subsagittata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its showy blooms and ability to climb or trail.
